cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 mi (225 km) SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to slow and arc north-northeast along the coast Tuesday–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Matagorda Bay / Port O’Connor–Freeport area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, Texas to Morgan City, Louisiana (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Baffin Bay northward through southeastern Texas and into southern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤20%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty squalls possible Monday night into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in Corpus Christi and Baffin bays Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches, isolated 20 inches, likely causing flash and urban flooding Monday through Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents; an isolated tornado possible Monday.
